body:
This issue started happening after I updated my Android Studio today. 

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Besides a regular `main.dart` file, create a new file say `home.dart`, and keep your cursor in that file. 
2. Do a full restart, you'll find the cursor is taken to the `main.dart` file. 


## Screenshot:
![ezgif com-gif-maker (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40364434/106392602-e4fdb600-63f2-11eb-89c3-663a136f947f.gif)



## Version info

```
[âœ“] Flutter (Channel dev, 1.25.0-8.0.pre, on Mac OS X 10.15.7 19H2 darwin-x64, locale en-US)
[âœ“] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 30.0.3)
[âœ“] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS (Xcode 12.3)
[âœ“] Chrome - develop for the web
[âœ“] Android Studio (version 4.1)
[âœ“] IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition (version 2020.3.2)
[âœ“] VS Code (version 1.49.0)
```

comment_data.body:
@dark-chocolate I'm not able to reproduce this problem. Does it specifically occur when a new file is made, or does this also occur when you move to an already-existing file and restart? Also, does this occur when you close out of a project and reopen (instead of restarting IntelliJ entirely)?

You can also post your version info from `flutter doctor -v` so we can see some additional details.

@helin24 

> Does it specifically occur when a new file is made, or does this also occur when you move to an already-existing file and restart?

It occurs in both the cases. 

> Also, does this occur when you close out of a project and reopen (instead of restarting IntelliJ entirely)?

Yes, it does. I tried simple closing/restarting/clearing cache and what not, but the problem persist. It started happening since I upgraded my Android Studio. It's very frustrating to be honest.

I'm also seeing the same issue in my IntelliJ IDEA (upgraded it along with Android Studio but didn't run it since then), here's the version :

```
IntelliJ IDEA 2020.3.2 (Community Edition)
Build #IC-203.7148.57, built on January 26, 2021
Runtime version: 11.0.9.1+11-b1145.77 x86_64
VM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o.
macOS 10.15.7
GC: ParNew, ConcurrentMarkSweep
Memory: 2014M
Cores: 4
Non-Bundled Plugins: com.ivanovych666.intellij.plugin.jsonsorter, Dart, io.flutter, org.jetbrains.kotlin
```

This simply means that there's no settings I tweaked accidentally; there might be something wrong with the updated IDEs or their Flutter equivalent updates.

@dark-chocolate What version of Dart and Flutter plugins are you using? In Android Studio and IntelliJ. As @helin24 mentioned, the output of `flutter version -v` (or in the IDE Tools>Flutter>Flutter Doctor) has everything we need.

@stevemessick I'm sorry I missed the last line of @helin24's message. 

Here's the full flutter doctor:


@dark-chocolate Thanks for the update!
@dark-chocolate Which platform are you running the app on? I see you have macos and chrome available.
@stevemessick I ran the app on Android, iOS and macOS. All of them were behaving the same.

Thanks for all the info. Unfortunately, I still cannot reproduce the problem. I'm using the code from your screenshot. One difference is that I'm on Flutter's master channel. (My home network is very slow so I only keep master and stable.) Any chance you could switch to master and see if the problem persists?

Also, I can't see the icon of the button you click to do hot restart. Just to make sure we're talking about the same thing, could you add a screen shot of that button?

@stevemessick 

> Also, I can't see the icon of the button you click to do hot restart. Just to make sure we're talking about the same thing, could you add a screen shot of that button?

I'm sorry I didn't get that. The icon is the full restart green colored button, isn't it? 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40364434/106717055-75104b00-65ff-11eb-8111-1295733e2a2c.png)

So, I upgraded to the master channel, but the problem persist.

### Screenshot
![ezgif com-gif-maker (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40364434/106721078-7b54f600-6604-11eb-96e2-55ecd1ebfa10.gif)

> The icon is the full restart green colored button, isn't it?

Actually, that is the `Run` button. The hot restart button is located in
the Debugger tool window. It looks kinda like a rounded rectangle with an
arrow in the top section, and has an orange line IIRC (middle of the night
for me, no IDE handy to check). I'm not sure why clicking `Run` would shift
focus to main.dart. But it is doing an entirely different thing than hot
restart. The hot restart button has hover text that shows "Hot Restart"
IIRC; you could try to find that one then click it to see if it shifts
focus for you.

Same problem here. It does not need a full restart, a hot-restart is enough to trigger this. The issue occured first after the recent flutter update.

> 
> 
> @stevemessick
> 
> > (middle of the night for me, no IDE handy to check)
> 
> You've my respect!!!
> I found the "hot restart" button in the debugger tool window, and clicking it does the same thing, it puts the cursor on the `MaterialApp` widget in the `main.dart` file. Only "hot reload" seems to work.
> 
> ![ezgif com-gif-maker (3)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40364434/106740542-d8f43d00-661a-11eb-8750-009a92bcc8d8.gif)
> 
> @Uni2K Make sure to upvote this issue.

Weird, I got the same behaviour with hot reload too. It also automatically opens main.dart if its not already open.
@Uni2K You forgot to upvote the issue. I'm not getting any kind of reputation if you do or don't upvote it. But if you do upvote, the community will pay more attention to it.
Same issue here, started after upgrading to Android Studio 4.1.2. Upvoted for visibility.

Thanks for the report! I can reproduce this.

```
IntelliJ IDEA 2020.3.2 (Community Edition)
Flutter plugin: 54.0.5-dev.1
```

```
Flutter 1.26.0-18.0.pre.189 â€¢ channel master â€¢ https://github.com/flutter/flutter
Framework â€¢ revision 06e9456a90 (3 hours ago) â€¢ 2021-02-04 11:51:03 -0500
Engine â€¢ revision 0d6e529c22
Tools â€¢ Dart 2.12.0 (build 2.12.0-285.0.dev)
```
@devoncarew Thankfully one of the members were able to reproduce the bug. It's more likely to get resolved now fast!
It looks like the Flutter Inspector tab is selecting the app's main widget after a restart, and that that is changing the file and selection of the active editor.

> 
> 
> @Uni2K You forgot to upvote the issue. I'm not getting any kind of reputation if you do or don't upvote it. But if you do upvote, the community will pay more attention to it.

Sorry, could not find the upvote button, still not finding it. :(
This should be addressed by https://github.com/flutter/devtools/pull/2675.
Sorry about this. The devtools fix has landed and a new version of devtools has been published (0.9.7+3). If you have intellij open, you will need to close your project and reopen it to get the fix.

title: Full restart takes to the main.dart file after recent update.
